Comprehensive GitHub Copilot instructions for consistent development

üìö GitHub Instruction Files Overview

This directory contains comprehensive instruction files for GitHub Copilot to ensure consistent, high-quality code generation throughout the MTM WIP Application development process. These files define coding standards, UI patterns, development workflows, and quality requirements using standard .NET patterns without ReactiveUI dependencies.

The instruction files are organized into categories covering core infrastructure, UI development, development patterns, automation, and quality assurance. All instructions have been updated to reflect the current standard .NET implementation using INotifyPropertyChanged, ICommand, and modern MVVM patterns.

üöÄ How to Use These Instructions

For Developers

  • Code Generation: Reference these instructions when using GitHub Copilot for consistent code patterns
  • Standard Compliance: Follow the coding conventions and naming standards defined in these files
  • UI Development: Use the UI instructions for Avalonia component generation and styling
  • Database Integration: Follow database patterns for stored procedure usage
  • Custom Prompts: Utilize specialized prompts for common development tasks
  • Quality Assurance: Apply quality standards during development and review

For GitHub Copilot Integration

  • Instruction Loading: These files provide context for GitHub Copilot code generation
  • Consistency Enforcement: Patterns defined here ensure consistent output across the project
  • Standard .NET Focus: All instructions emphasize standard .NET MVVM patterns
  • MTM Business Rules: Instructions include MTM-specific requirements and data patterns
  • Error Prevention: Guidelines help prevent common issues like AVLN2000 errors
